title: Kamala Harris Signs With CAA As She Eyes Next Political Moves
description: Kamala Harris has signed with CAA, returning to the agency that represented her before she became vice president. author: Ted Johnson
excerpt: Kamala Harris has signed with CAA, returning to the agency that represented her before she became vice president. Her signing comes just a couple weeks after the agency announced that it would represent former President Joe Biden. CAA’s representation of Harris will be in all areas, with a focus on speaking engagements and publishing, the […]
text: Kamala Harris has signed with CAA, returning to the agency that represented her before she became vice president. Her signing comes just a couple weeks after the agency announced that it would represent former President Joe Biden. CAA’s representation of Harris will be in all areas, with a focus on speaking engagements and publishing, the agency said. “CAA will work closely with Harris on her post-White House initiatives, creating strategic opportunities that expand her platform in support of the issues she has championed throughout decades-long career in public service,” CAA said. CAA represented her when she was a U.S. senator, a period in which she published her memoir, The Truths We Hold: An American Journey. Watch on Deadline Harris and her husband, Doug Emhoff, have returned to Los Angeles. There has been speculation that Harris may return to politics with a run for governor of California next year. Harris will receive the Chairman’s Award at the NAACP Image Awards ceremony on Saturday.
html:
Kamala Harris has signed with CAA, returning to the agency that represented her before she became vice president.

Her signing comes just a couple weeks after the agency announced that it would represent former President Joe Biden.

CAA’s representation of Harris will be in all areas, with a focus on speaking engagements and publishing, the agency said.

“CAA will work closely with Harris on her post-White House initiatives, creating strategic opportunities that expand her platform in support of the issues she has championed throughout decades-long career in public service,” CAA said.

CAA represented her when she was a U.S. senator, a period in which she published her memoir, The Truths We Hold: An American Journey.

Watch on Deadline

Harris and her husband, Doug Emhoff, have returned to Los Angeles. There has been speculation that Harris may return to politics with a run for governor of California next year.

Harris will receive the Chairman’s Award at the NAACP Image Awards ceremony on Saturday.
